pr_title: on H2 after 2.0 don't need column type workaround (H5)

timeline.message:
on H2 after 2.0 don't need column type workaround

Apparently H2 correctly reports column types via JDBC metadata
since 2.0, so this workaround is unnecessary.

Also add a default mapping for DECIMAL in superclass, just for
completeness.

cc @famod

timeline.body: btw, there is a related ticket for the above `float' issue: https://github.com/hibernate/hibernate-orm/pull/2855
timeline.bodyText: btw, there is a related ticket for the above `float' issue: #2855
timeline.bodyHTML: btw, there is a related ticket for the above `float' issue: #2855
timeline.author: NathanQingyangXu

replies.bodyText: The more I see issues like this, the more I think the problem isn't in the Dialects, it's in the stupid schema validation that doesn't realize that float and real and double are all the same thing, and that numeric and decimal are the same thing. We could easily fix this whole class of idiotic bugs in one swoop by making the schema validator/update tools non-stupid.
replies.author: gavinking

replies.bodyText: And Table.validateColumns(), I suppose, except that that method doesn't seem to be called anywhere.
